messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Digest Number 517
messages.msgSnippet: ... Certainly nothing mechanical. Maybe sundials, stars or candles but no mechanical clocks. Why start anything at an exact time after all? That s a Western
messages.messageBody:
>
>
> From: Richardson Paul <umaryu@...>
>Subject: Re: Re: Clocks
>
>HI James and others
>
>thanks some really nice info on time keeping in Japan
>during and after the Edo period, but what about before
>then
>
>Surely they didnt wait for the cock to crow. There
>must have been some method of time keeping so that
>occassions and events could start at a set time.
>
>
Certainly nothing mechanical. Maybe sundials, stars or candles but no
mechanical clocks. Why start anything at an exact time after all? That's
a Western obsession of that period after all.

> From: Eponymous13@...
>
>Hey there. Me again.
> Maybe I can be of some help. (Maybe not, time will tell. 8-)!)
>
>
I seem to remember reading something about that myself.

Yours,
Jim Eckman
